project: VETTR Discovery Page Enhancements ‚Äî Web + Android
description: Port the Discovery page enhancements (multi-select sector filter + 6 featured collections) to the web app (Next.js) and Android app (Kotlin/Compose). Backend already has /discovery/collections endpoint and multi-sector /stocks filter.

stories.title: Web: Multi-select sector filter on Discovery page
stories.description:
Update the Discovery page at src/app/(main)/discovery/page.tsx to support multi-select sector chips instead of single-select.

Current behavior:
- `selectedSector` is a single string state (`'All'` or a sector name)
- Clicking a chip sets it as the only selected sector
- URL param: `?sector=Gold`

New behavior:
- Replace `const [selectedSector, setSelectedSector] = useState<string>(...)` with `const [selectedSectors, setSelectedSectors] = useState<Set<string>>(new Set())`
- When selectedSectors is empty, treat as 'All' (no sector filter)
- 'All' button clears the set
- Clicking a sector chip toggles it in/out of the set
- Multiple chips can be selected simultaneously
- URL param: `?sectors=Gold,Silver` (comma-separated)
- Initialize from URL: parse `sectors` param, split by comma into Set

Chip styling update:
- Selected: `bg-vettr-accent/10 border border-vettr-accent/30 text-vettr-accent` (same as current)
- Unselected: `bg-white/5 border border-white/10 text-gray-400 hover:text-white hover:bg-white/10` (same as current)
- 'All' chip: selected styling when selectedSectors is empty

Filter logic update in `filteredStocks`:
```
if (selectedSectors.size > 0) {
  result = result.filter((s) => selectedSectors.has(s.sector));
}
```

Also update `filteredFilings`:
```
if (selectedSectors.size > 0) {
  return filings.filter((filing) => {
    const stock = allStocks.find((s) => s.ticker === filing.ticker);
    return stock?.sector && selectedSectors.has(stock.sector);
  });
}
```

Update URL sync to use `sectors` param with comma-separated values.
Update empty state messages to handle multi-select.

Must pass `npm run build`.
acceptance: User can tap multiple sector chips to select them
Tapping a selected chip deselects it
Stock list and filings filter correctly by multiple sectors
URL syncs with comma-separated sectors param

stories.title: Web: Add Collection Detail page
stories.description:
Create a new page at `src/app/(main)/discovery/collection/[id]/page.tsx` that shows the stocks in a specific collection. The page receives the collection ID from the URL params. It should: 1. Fetch collections using `useDiscoveryCollections()` hook 2. Find the matching collection by ID from the fetched data 3. Display collection header: icon, name, tagline, criteria summary 4. Display stock list in a table/card format Also create `src/app/(main)/discovery/collection/[id]/layout.tsx` with proper metadata. Page Layout: ```
{icon}

{collection.name}

{collection.tagline}

{collection.criteria_summary}

{collection.stocks.map(stock => ( router.push(`/stocks/${stock.ticker}`)} /> ))}
``` StockRow should show: ticker (bold, accent), company name, sector badge, price, price change (green/red), VETR score badge. Design the StockRow inline (don't import the main StockCard ‚Äî it expects a different data shape). Keep it simple: ```
{stock.ticker} {stock.name}
${stock.price?.toFixed(2) || 'N/A'} = 0 ? 'text-green-400' : 'text-red-400'}`}> {stock.price_change >= 0 ? '+' : ''}{stock.price_change?.toFixed(1) || '0.0'}%
``` Loading state: Show skeleton while loading 404 state: If collection not found, show 'Collection not found' with link back to Discovery IMPORTANT: Use `'use client'` directive at top of page.tsx. Wrap in Suspense if using hooks. Must pass `npm run build`.

stories.title: Android: Multi-select sector filter on Discovery screen
stories.description:
Update the Android Discovery screen to support multi-select sector chips instead of single-select.

Changes to DiscoveryViewModel.kt:
1. Change `_selectedSector` from `MutableStateFlow("All")` (single String) to `_selectedSectors` as `MutableStateFlow<Set<String>>(emptySet())`
2. Expose as `val selectedSectors: StateFlow<Set<String>>`
3. Replace `selectSector(sector: String)` with `toggleSector(sector: String)` that adds/removes from set
4. Add `clearSectors()` that sets empty set (equivalent to 'All')
5. Update `applyFilters()` to filter by multiple sectors:
```kotlin
val sectorFiltered = if (sectors.isEmpty()) allStocks
else allStocks.filter { stock -> stock.sector in sectors }
```
6. Update filings filtering similarly

Changes to DiscoveryScreen.kt:
1. Collect `val selectedSectors by viewModel.selectedSectors.collectAsStateWithLifecycle()`
2. Update sector chip rendering:
   - 'All' chip: `selected = selectedSectors.isEmpty()`, onClick calls `viewModel.clearSectors()`
   - Individual sector chips: `selected = sector in selectedSectors`, onClick calls `viewModel.toggleSector(sector)`
3. Update empty state messages to handle multi-select context

Must compile successfully. Verify with: `cd /Users/manav/Space/code/vettr-android && ./gradlew app:compileDebugKotlin 2>&1 | tail -5`
acceptance: User can tap multiple sector chips to select them
Tapping a selected chip deselects it
Stock list and filings filter correctly by multiple sectors
